conclusion: To calculate the work done by the gas on the surroundings during the cyclic process from the given PV diagram.
The process consists of three segments: A → B (Isobaric expansion), B → C (Linear process), C → A (Isobaric compression).
Work done by the system in a PV diagram is calculated as the area under the curve.
Segment A → B: Volume changes from V_A = 2 L to V_B = 2 L, Pressure P = 4 x 10^5 Pa.
Work done for A → B: W_AB = P ΔV = 4 x 10^5 x (2 - 2) = 0 J.
Segment B → C: Base = V_C - V_B = (5 - 2) = 3 L, Height = P_B - P_C = (4 - 1) x 10^5 Pa = 3 x 10^5 Pa.
Work done for B → C: W_BC = 1/2 x 3 x 10^-3 m^3 x 3 x 10^5 Pa = 450 J.
Segment C → A: Volume changes from V_C = 5 L to V_A = 2 L, Pressure P = 1 x 10^5 Pa.
Work done for C → A: W_CA = P ΔV = 1 x 10^5 x (5 - 2) x 10^-3 = -300 J.
Total work done: W_total = W_AB + W_BC + W_CA = 0 + 450 + (-300) = 150 J.
The work done by the gas on the surroundings during the cyclic process is 150 J.
